# Nouns DAO V2.1 Minor Fix

## Summary

This proposal updates the Nouns DAO logic contract to a new version, with a single minor improvement:

**Vote with Gas Refund**: change refund destination such that multisig voter that pays for gas get refunded, rather than sending the refund to the multisig contract. 

Technically, this change involves refunding `tx.origin` instead of `msg.sender`.

Exact changes can be seen here: https://github.com/nounsDAO/nouns-monorepo/pull/604

Because this change is very minor, we're not going through an official audit process. This change has been reviewed thoroughly by technical DAO members (solimander & vapeape).

## Proposal Transactions for Humans

* `_setImplementation`: upgrades DAO logic to V2.1.

For any questions, we're available on the #54-tech-grants channel on the nounish discord

# Nouns Name Service Expansion  ‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®

**TL;DR After being funded for [2ETH by Prop House](https://prop.house/nouns/round-2/63) 7 months ago, we have built an entire, functioning naming service called Nouns Name Service (NNS, built on the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® domain.) We are now asking the DAO to fund us to bring Nouns Name Service to the next level.**

The Nouns Name Service (nns.xyz) is a naming system that aims to empower communities and spread the nounish culture.

The main Top Level Domain of the Nouns Name Service is the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® .

Just as a .eth is resolved in yourname.eth, having a .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  will allow you to attach the Nouns DAO noggles to your on-chain identity and be resolved as yourname.‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® .

[![nns-screen.png](https://i.postimg.cc/7YhPfPhN/nns-screen.png)](https://postimg.cc/crqGzSQK)
[*nns.xyz*](https://nns.xyz)

## Background
The Nouns Name Service (NNS) received 2 ETH in Prop House ‚Äì Round 2 (April 2022) as trial funding to prove out the concept and build our reputation as trustworthy builders in the ecosystem.
 
After 4 months of work we delivered the first version of the NNS (nns.xyz) and in the first month post-launch, we have already created a powerful ecosystem of partners which allowed the NNS to be natively resolved across the Nouns ecosystem.

[![Xva8Rxz7.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/MZCxK0kz/Xva8Rxz7.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/6TfFMv5P)

## Summary
This proposal will allow the NNS to build the infrastructure required to start phase 2 of our strategy: Expansion.

In particular, these are the main goals of this phase, which will be completed over a 5 months period:

* Integrate the NNS into new DAOs, apps and marketplaces outside the Nouniverse.
* Integration of an additional .nouns TLD that will help overcome .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® copy-paste problems on external apps making its applications more flexible and effective.
* Create a DAO powered by Nouns Builder to empower the NNS Squad, our community of people who got their .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®, with an experimental treasury to reward members and finance new initiatives.
* Build new utility tools around the NNS. The first in the pipeline is a nounish NNS version of EtherScan. 
* Launch the Nounish Club project to push proliferation in and outside the Nouniverse through a new experiment of community reward and participation.
* Create a full documentation for end-users and developers expanding the ways in which they can integrate the NNS in their projects.
* Start the first experiments and collaborations for Phase 3.

**Requesting** funding of 195 ETH to execute our Expansion Phase.

Funds will be immediately converted in USDC to avoid volatility exposure of any kind.

[![NNS-proposal-artwork-2.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/yd7g5qPr/NNS-proposal-artwork-2.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/SXtx2vHW)

## How the NNS started
The idea of the NNS originated from a question:
 
*‚ÄúIs there a way to transform a meme icon into a fully functional domain, where its utility grows proportionally to the meme adoption?‚Äù*
 
During the first months of work, this idea evolved from its very first draft on Prop House, letting the NNS become a possible solution to several interesting scenarios:
 
* In an ecosystem based on CC0 like the Nouniverse, with a lot of new communities and sub-DAOs, the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® could become a universal tool for companies and creators to interact with the entire ecosystem at once.
***How so?***
The power of a CC0 ecosystem is the proliferation of a main idea in many sub-projects and communities. In the Nouniverse, that idea is represented by the ‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® meme. The noggles appear in every nounish community, but at the same time they are part of different NFTs and collections. At the moment, there isn‚Äôt a token that can unify the Nouns ecosystem at an infrastructural level. The .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® can fill this gap, allowing companies and creators to reach the whole ecosystem by simply integrating the NNS into their token-gated experiences and initiatives.

* The more the NNS is integrated on new apps and marketplaces across the world, the more the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  will help spread the nounish culture at an exponential level.
***How so?***
The NNS serves as an on-chain identity badge for all the people who share the nounish culture. Having your .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  attached to your web3 identity makes it clear that you belong to the ‚Äúnounish internet society‚Äù. The more the NNS will expand, the more the Nouns proliferation will reach places that wouldn‚Äôt even have been considered before.

* In a market dominated by 2 titan projects and few TLDs, the NNS could become the first experiment of a collaborative naming system on ETH. This would allow other communities to join the NNS and create their own TLD on top of the NNS, making the whole protocol stronger and more widely adopted, and offering the new communities the advantage of having their TLD natively resolved across the NNS network from day 1. 
***How so?***
Once the Nouns Name Service is globally recognised by important apps in the space, it could open its network to other communities as well. This way, communities will not only get their customized TLD (that‚Äôs nothing new), but this will be able to be natively resolved everywhere from the very beginning. This will literally onboard in the Nouniverse and in Nouns DAO whole communities made by end-users and talented builders, constantly bringing new ideas and improving engagement thanks to a proven system of funding based on Prop House, Small Grants and all the other nounish DAOs.

**In a nutshell,** for a community joining the NNS would mean not only having a naming infrastructure, but also being able to build and nurture important relationships in the Nouniverse that will push new ideas and collaborations with the entire ecosystem.

These applications, which at the moment represent our focus, will offer Nouns and the Nouniverse an important value in terms of proliferation, new users in existing nounish platforms and the attraction of new builders.

And we are confident this is just the beginning of many other applications for the NNS.

[![Nouns-Name-Service-NNS-works.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/CKSxMGqR/Nouns-Name-Service-NNS-works.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/bZVh32LP)

## Roadmap (The 3 Phases)
Building this kind of Naming System is a big task. Which is why we split our development in 3 Phases. After the first one is completed, the NNS will be able to move to the next one, and so on.

### PHASE 1: Core Ecosystem and Community
The power of any protocol lies in its network.
That‚Äôs why our top priority since launch has always been to build a strong core ecosystem from which we can expand.

While new naming systems often rely on external plugins to resolve their names, the NNS aims to create a network where every NNS name is natively resolved without any additional action by the users.
 
At the time of writing, the NNS has been supported by all the major nounish projects, officially connecting the Nouniverse. 

[![Nouns-Name-Service-NNS-projects.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/SNcXyNvt/Nouns-Name-Service-NNS-projects.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/RNVCd99c)
 
**ENS reservation period and stats:** 

During the first 60 days after launch NNS names could only be claimed by their correspondent .eth.
 
While this impacted the NNS growth in the very short term, it also allowed the early adopters to have full control of their identities, thus focusing more on identity than speculation.

The ENS reservation ended on 19 October 2022 with the following results:

* 355 names claimed
* 252 unique owners
 
As you‚Äôre reading this, after 4 months of development and 2 months of Reservation Period, Phase 1 is officially completed.

At this time, 2 weeks after the end of the Reservation Period, a total of 526 .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  names have been registered from 311 unique owners.

[![nns-launch-artwork.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/KvH4WgjG/nns-launch-artwork.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/mt7bzk7J)

### PHASE 2: Expansion and Nounish Club

Phase 2 will start the real proliferation of the NNS.

As mentioned in the TL;DR, the Expansion phase will have several goals, starting from the integration of the NNS in new DAOs, apps and marketplaces outside the Nouns ecosystem, also solving the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® current copy-paste issue. 

Part of the Expansion will also be the building of an NNS Scan, which you can picture like an NNS version of EtherScan. We will also create a new and more complete website, where end-users and developers will be able to access a full documentation so that they can find new ways to integrate the NNS in their projects. 

The NNS Squad will also have access to an experimental Treasury which will be used to reward active members and finance new missions.

Finally, and what we believe is the most exciting part of this Phase, we will launch the Nounish Club project to push proliferation through an experimental form of community reward and participation. 

At the end of these developments, we will start the first experiments and collaborations for Phase 3. 

### The Nounish Club 

The Nounish Club is an experiment made to reward nouners, nounish projects and communities outside the Nouniverse through new forms of community participation.
 
The idea is to allocate to this initiative all the numbers from 0 to 9999.‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®, making them a new coveted asset to stimulate NNS proliferation and inspire new community ideas.

However, these numbers won't be available to be bought from the NNS.

They will only be earnable by taking active part in .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® proliferation and in special initiatives, and they will be entirely distributed for free through what we like to call a ‚ÄúProof of Proliferation‚Äù process. 

The Nounish Club will be an exclusive group inside the NNS, completely in the hands of the Nouniverse.
 
Every nounish project will be able to add a special benefit to the club, such as discounts, NFTs, voting power, early accesses and more. They will also be able to ask the NNS to get a specific allocation of numbers to be shared among their communities or to be used as assets to keep in their treasury.
 
The more benefits will be added, the more the access to the Nounish Club will be valued.

Here are some key points of how this would work:

* The NNS will allocate an initial amount of numbers to the NNS Squad DAO created through Nouns Builder. This will add an additional asset to the treasury that will be managed according to DAO voting.
* For the first 6 months, the numbers from 0 to 669 will be reserved for Nouners. Every existing nouner, as well as new ones, can request their specific numbers offering their help to proliferate the Nouns Name Service or to add benefits to make the Nounish Club more valuable. 
* Specific numbers would be used to invite new strategic users into the Nouns ecosystem.
* Nounish DAOs and projects would be able to request a certain allocation of numbers for proliferation initiatives. This will make the distribution of the Nounish Club more and more decentralized.
* If the experimental allocation to the NNS Squad DAO is successful, the NNS will gradually allocate a bigger amount of numbers to the DAO over time. 

The Nounish Club benefits will be grouped on a url like nounishclub.wtf and new proposals about ideas, benefits and allocations can be managed through the NNS Squad DAO and discussed on the NNS Discord.

The Nounish Club will also use Prophouse as another important tool to generate and reward new ideas.

#### Why the Nounish Club?

We are exploring what the NNS can become through a continuous loop of never-tried before experiments and feedback. The Nounish Club is one of them.

The reason we are excited about the Nounish Club is that we believe it can be an interesting experiment which, if successful, will be able to create a massive value for every community in the Nouns ecosystem.

This value can be seen as:

* **Building value:** It will be a further incentive for nounish communities to build cool things for the NNS and the Nounish Club.
* **Proliferation value:** It will generate a further proliferation of the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  and can be used to onboard strategic users into the Nouns ecosystem.
* **Economic value:** The more the NNS and the Nounish Club will grow, the more every name of the Club will be valuable (incentivizing more building around it).

[![NNSproposal-artwork3.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/90rG85XH/NNSproposal-artwork3.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/hQRzvY72)

### PHASE 3: Protocol

Once the NNS is supported by the major platforms in the space and successfully completes all the other tasks, it will be ready to open the protocol to other communities.
 
This upgrade will allow other great projects to build their TLD on top of the Nouns Name Service.
 
This will strengthen the relationship between the Nouniverse and worldwide communities working together for the proliferation of the Nouns Name Service.
 
Dwelling on the developments of Phase 3 is not the focus of this proposal, which aims to focus on the Expansion and Phase 2. However, our ultimate mission is making Nouns the center of a naming revolution that will attract not only end users, but also companies and other big projects.
 
Some aspects of Phase 3 are still being brainstormed and we can‚Äôt wait to share more details with the community when they‚Äôll be ready.

## FUNDS

### Personal context for full transparency from Dom (@dotnouns)

Besides the 2 ETH received from Prop House in April, all the NNS development was bootstrapped.

As a founder and a true believer in the NNS, since the end of May I decided to commit 90% of my time on the project, gradually reducing the personal clients I was following in my day job.
 
If this can seem a hazard to many, burning the bridges that could act as a way out allowed the project to be laser focused on execution and allowed the NNS to become what it is today.
 
The goal of this proposal is helping the NNS to build a starting fund that will push the development and the proliferation with the same laser focus that has characterized Phase 1.

### The request in a nutshell

We are requesting 195 ETH to scale the NNS, fully complete Phase 2 and begin experiments for Phase 3 as well.

Funds will be immediately converted in USDC to avoid volatility of any kind.

### How the funds will be used

The funding from this proposal will serve to develop the following areas, which will be crucial for the long-term success:
 
¬∑  	**Expand the team** and hire top professionals for specific tasks or projects. In particular, main focus will be given to external integrations and community building.
¬∑  	**Design a website** that will offer more support to end users and developers. This will include an extensive tech documentation and FAQ section.
¬∑  	**Create a DAO for the NNS Squad through Nouns Builder.** The DAO treasury will be used to coordinate proliferation actions among members and to manage the allocation of numbers for the Nounish Club.
¬∑  	**Create an NNS House on Prop House** focused on building new products for the NNS ecosystem, the Nounish Club and developing new integrations with important partners.
¬∑  	**Push proliferation** in and outside the Nouns ecosystem through the Nounish Club.
¬∑  	**Add a new .nouns TLD** that will help overcome .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® copy-paste problems on external apps, thus making its applications more flexible and effective. 

### Thoughts about the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  copy-paste ‚Äúissue‚Äù

One frequent objection about the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  is that noggles are not easy to type on the keyboard. This is indisputably true.

The .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®  is first of all an identity badge of the Nouniverse. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs natively resolved on all the nounish platforms without any effort or action by the user.

Even if every tool built around the NNS would make writing the .‚åê‚ó®-‚ó® easy as a click, to expand the applications of the Nouns Name Service we are also exploring the creation of a .nouns TLD.
This domain would ease the integration of the NNS in several apps (especially wallets) and would unlock interesting additional applications.

In the future, NNS users would be able to connect all their NNS names to this core extension and from their dashboard they could decide how they want to appear in their favorite communities.

This development is still in brainstorming mode, but we wanted to share it to give some context about our initial focus and what we‚Äôre going to work on next.

### Milestones and funding release

In an effort to show our commitment and laser focus in the NNS mission, we decided to divide the funding allocation in 2 tranches.

The first 97.5 ETH will be unlocked upfront and will cover the first 3 months.
In particular, during this period we will: 

* Launch and proliferate the Nounish Club project and its DAO
* Release the new website with a full documentation
* Complete the first new integrations with projects outside the Nouns ecosystem
* Start the first experiments with the .nouns extension. (If everything works smoothly we will be able to release it during the first 3 months, otherwise it will be launched in month 4.)

The list only refers to the goals highlighted in this proposal and doesn't include actions that will be part of the ordinary proliferation strategy of the NNS, such as community initiatives, viral actions and collabs with other projects in and outside the Nouns ecosystem.

At the end of the first 3 months, these milestones will be checked and verified by nouns community members Toady Hawk and Benbodhi.

If this first Milestone Check is successful, the second and last part of the funding will be released.

### Multisig Wallet

Funds will be managed through a Gnosis multisig wallet (2/3) with the following trusted signers:

* [Dotnouns](https://twitter.com/dotnouns) (NNS)
* [Toady Hawk](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/toadyhawk.%E2%8C%90%E2%97%A8-%E2%97%A8) (Proposal Sponsor and Milestones Checker)
* [Benbodhi](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/benbodhi.%E2%8C%90%E2%97%A8-%E2%97%A8) (Milestone Checker)

## Conclusion

This is what the Nouns Name Service is right now, and what it could become.

We realize it‚Äôs an ambitious vision, and that there might be challenges and many things we didn‚Äôt predict, as for every venture in unexplored waters. 

However, ever since the beginning, we‚Äôve tried to earn the community‚Äôs trust. We are now fully committing ourselves to something that could be extremely beneficial for the Nouns ecosystem in the long term.

**If you believe in this project, we ask you to consider supporting this proposal, so that we can together build the future of the Nouns Name Service!**

# DCS Pod

## tl;dr ##
DCS is a pod that focuses on bridging the gap between existing off-chain funding options and larger on-chain props. Focused primarily on the sectors of software, arts and IRL with a funding range between 8-25Œû, our goal is to help builders with a track record scale up within the Nouns ecosystem.

## Overview ##

There currently exists a large gap within the current Nouns funding landscape that creates challenges for Nounish builders in the ecosystem. 

On the lower end of the spectrum, there are many options for builders to seek funding for <10Œû, between NSFW, Prop House, and a number of subDAO efforts (Gnars, SharkDAO, Lil Nouns, etc). On the higher end, there is virtually no limit as we have seen on-chain props go to $1M and beyond.

However, in between these two points there is a gap that continues to grow as we see NSFW, Prop House, and subDAOs prefering to run more experiments with smaller amounts, all the while prominent Nouners are increasingly calling for the DAO to scale upward and not consider on-chain props lower than 20Œû.

This places builders in a tough spot where they must figure out how to take their concept from point A to point B to achieve escape velocity. This issue is further exacerbated by the closure of the official Nouns Discord server, which will make it harder for the DAO to reach consensus on on-chain props as a governing body.

DCS will focus on working with these builders who have "graduated" from one of the off-chain funding programs and provide them with bridge funding and guidance as they work towards the goal of passing a larger scale on-chain prop with the broader DAO base.

Said a different way, we help builders **Do Cool Sh*t**.

![](https://i.imgur.com/pMkWTM2.png)

## Pod Details ##

DCS pod members will leverage their Nounish network and experience to guide and work with builders to ensure their further success in the DAO. DCS will act as a working group to ensure our funded builders are provided more than just capital but an active group to collaborate with and build alongside.

**The pod plays a key role in four ways:**

- Creates a stepping stone for off-chain "graduates" on their journey to larger on-chain props, both in terms of financial support and guidance in refining their project
- Provides accountability and additional data points for the broader DAO to consider when the resulting props go on-chain
- Emphasizes a transparent decision making framework that is data-driven and scalable
- Actively works with builders to ensure their further success in the DAO by being a source of active support and guidance helping them move through the roadblocks and challenges they face

**What areas will the pod focus on?**

DCS will focus on key areas where we feel we can provide the most value and help ideas scale quickly. Given the subject matter expertise and experience of pod members, the following areas are our initial focus: 

- **Software** - dApps, smart contracts, mobile apps, gaming
- **Arts & Content** - artists, musicians, video and content creators
- **IRL** - local/regional activations, events, and other on-the-ground efforts


**How will the group operate?**

- Props (sourced from off-chain funding programs) will be be submitted to the pod online
- Prop will be discussed on weekly DCS calls
- Prop will be voted on in the DCS Discord

We will work with the operators of the various off-chain funding program to raise visibility for DCS as a "next step" for graduates. We will use Prop House and/or [AddressBoard](https://www.addressform.io/) to receive formal funding requests, so we can ensure proper data collection throughout the process for the DAO.

The pod will convene once a week on an open call to discuss what has been submitted since the last meeting and to discuss additional pipeline developments. These calls will be available to the community. This will foster discussion about props, help engage with builders and elevate the quality of props that get funded. Emphasis will be placed on data-driven processes to ensure greater builder accountability and proper measurement of ROI back to the DAO.

After discussion, pod members will decide which props will be funded by voting on a dedicated Discord channel (or via Prop House platform).

Pod members are required to attend weekly meetings and actively give feedback on props. Pod members can be removed and replaced based on participation (which will be decided by the remaining members of the pod). Pod members will be rotated every 3-6 months in order to spread knowledge, boost decentralization and to ensure the pod is not overly reliant on any single member. A maximum of 2 pod members will be substituted at a time, not to create disruption in the work flow. One pod member will be elected secretary by the pod, and this person will take care of administrative tasks including providing a summary of the meeting in writing, which will be available to the public through the DCS discord.

The committee‚Äôs gnosis safe will require 3 of 5 members to sign.

Budget: 126Œû
Breakdown:

* Admin: 51Œû
    * Target prop funding: ranging from ~9x8Œû - 3x25Œû projects
    * 5 pod members
        * Core member: 3Œû per month
        * Secretary: add'l 2Œû per month

For context, this is 0,4% of our treasury. We are aiming to propose a low-risk/high-reward pod.

# Fund Trustless USDC Payments Contract

## Summary

In order to pay builders directly with USDC, we have deployed a contract (`TokenBuyer`) which swaps ETH for USDC on behalf of the DAO.

We propose to fund `TokenBuyer` with 625 ETH in order to acquire a USDC buffer of $500K (there's a baked in volatility buffer; any extra ETH will be used for later proposals or can come back to the treasury).

Future proposals created from nouns.wtf will automatically "top off" TokenBuyer with additional ETH, minimizing the need for additional funding proposals.

## Motivation

Many proposals have costs in USD (or other fiat currencies) and would prefer to request USDC for the DAO instead of ETH.

It is not trivial to swap ETH to USDC at proposal execution time without being subjected to sandwich attacks and getting bad swap rates.

## Solution

The tech pod developed [TokenBuyer](https://github.com/nounsDAO/token-buyer) - a suite of smart contracts that allow permissionless swapping of tokens.

TokenBuyer will allow proposals to request payment amount in USDC.

The swapping of ETH to USDC happens asynchronously, meaning:
If the DAO doesn't have enough USDC on hand, it will register a debt for the remaining amount. As soon as the rest of the USDC is available, it is sent to the recipient's wallet, no user intervention needed. We expect this to take a few days at most, depending on the total amount.

TokenBuyer allows anyone to swap USDC for the ETH it holds. It uses Chainlink's ETH/USD price feed to set the price.

Whenever a proposal requests USDC from the DAO, it will also include a transaction to top up TokenBuyer with additional ETH, proportional to the USDC amount requested.

(*This "automatic top-off" is part of nouns.wtf; other governance clients can choose whether they implement this behavior*)

### Example:
* Builder A creates a proposal that requests 100,000 USDC
* 2 actions will be added to the proposal:
    1. Send 100K USDC from the TokenBuyer to Builder A
    2. Send $150K worth of ETH to TokenBuyer to swap for USDC
       * The extra $50K (50% buffer) is added in case ETH price goes down
       * If TokenBuyer already holds ETH, then it will be sent less ETH accordingly
* When the proposal executes:
    1. 100K USDC it sent to Builder A
        * If TokenBuyer has less than 100K USDC on hand, a debt will be registered towards Builder A
    3. TokenBuyer will swap ETH for 100K USDC
    4. Any remaining USDC debt to Builder A is paid as soon as it is swapped

### UI preview

This is a preview of a new proposal creation flow for nouns.wtf developed by Brian.
It will go live once it's possible to request USDC.

![proposal_ui_1](https://i.imgur.com/cOqFO3V.png)
![proposal_ui_2](https://i.imgur.com/vZNqCJ7.png)

### Parameters

* `baselinePaymentTokenAmount`: amount of USDC to hold "on hand". Currently set to $500,000.
* `botDiscountBPs`: a price discount to incentivize anyone (probably bots) to swap USDC for ETH. Currently set to 10 bps (0.1%).

### Admin access
* The tech pod & the DAO have an "operator" privilege with permissions to:
    * Modify `baselinePaymentTokenAmount`, allowed range is: 0 - $1M
    * Modify `botDiscountBPs`, allowed range is: 0-150 (0-1.5%)
    * Pause TokenBuyer swaps
    * Withdraw ETH from TokenBuyer and send it to the DAO
    * Change the operator
* Only the DAO has the ability to:
    * Send USDC
    * Change the allowed ranges for `baselinePaymentTokenAmount` and `botDiscountBPs`

### Arbitrage bot
* A reference bot has been developed and [open-sourced](https://github.com/solimander/eth-buyer-arbitrage-bot) by solimander. We encourage anyone to run their own bot or improve on the code
* The tech pod will be running the reference bot at the beginning to bootstrap the system
* Anyone can perform swaps against TokenBuyer. If we see low activity, we will increase the `botDiscountBPs` parameters to increase the incentive (e.g. if gas prices become high).

## Auditing and Testing

* The smart contracts were audited by yAcademy. [Audit report](https://github.com/nounsDAO/token-buyer/blob/166ec30ecd5dada8e17b55317ce3823d4c36b35f/audit/yAcademy_NounsDAO_TokenBuyer_review.pdf)
    * No "critical" issues were found
    * 1 "high" and 1 "medium" issues were found. The "high" issue was fixed, and the "medium" issue was acknowledged as not being an issue for us.
* Prior to this proposal a few rounds of funding and spending using Token Buyer were done on mainnet


## Funding
* Assuming `baselinePaymentTokenAmount` is set to $500K, we would want to fund TokenBuyer with enough ETH to swap for $500K. We suggested adding an extra 50% to account for price changes. At current ETH prices this 750,000 / 1200 = 625 ETH
* The initial ETH amount will be sent to the tech pod multisig
* The tech pod will deploy it into TokenBuyer in chunks while monitoring that it performs correctly

# Sail Nouns in the New York Harbor for NFT.NYC 2023

![](https://i.imgur.com/PHkFAtJ.jpg)

### TL;DR
 - Fleet of seven J/24 sailboats with Nounish sails and one bigger sailboat
 - Photo and video opportunities in front of Manhattan, Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty
 - 100 guests onboard will actively participate by steering boats and trimming sails 
 - Post-event meetup at the Manhattan Yacht Club‚Äôs clubhouse

# Description

### Why Sailing?
I ([fiveoceans_dev](https://twitter.com/fiveoceans_dev)) have been sailing for 11 years and recently combined my passion for sailing and love of Nouns by organizing a regatta through Seoul (funded by [Prop 102](https://nouns.wtf/vote/102)). Sailing is one of the most prestigious sports and often gets attention of the media, guests, and residents. It's enjoyable to participate in, to watch live, and creates beautiful images and video to share.


### Nouns in the New York Harbor
NFT.NYC is only four months away. Most likely NFT and web3 projects are going to run the same promotions with posters and billboards. *Why not make something different?*

Following the success of [Prop 102](https://nouns.wtf/vote/102), I would like to organize a sailing event on April 9th in New York with help of Manhattan Yacht Club. The NFT.NYC sailing event is going to be order of magnitute larger to match the gravity of the legendary New York.


I will put together a fleet of seven J/24 sailboats and one bigger sailboat in New York bay with Nounish sails. We are going to invite Nounish people and sail together from New Jersey to Manhattan, Brooklyn Bridge, and the Statue of Liberty.

We'll be using J/24 sailboats for this event because it is the world's most popular one-design keelboat. It is a classic Porsche of sailing and respected by all sailors. It is easy to sail and looks beautiful when you get up the Nounish spinnakers.


### Interactive Community Building
The plan is to make teams of 3 experienced sailors and 3-4 guests for each boat. The guests will be able to actively participate by steering boats and trimming sails. We are going to use one bigger boat to accomodate all guests and swap guests on boats near the Statue Of Liberty so all the guests can get full experience. 100 people will be invited, with priority to for the Nouns community. 20 invitations will be sent to special NFT.NYC attendees (media, artists, etc.) 

It is going to be unforgettable experience. Later, we can gather together at Manhattan Yacht Club's clubhouse and share a few beers.

Let's enjoy early spring sailing in NYC together and use this unique opportunity as a team building and proliferating event. A lot of New Yorkers and visitors are going to see Nouns logos during NFT.NYC and posted on social networks.

### Documentation
All events/locations before and during the event will be documented and all media will be regularly shared with the [nounish ‚åê‚ó®-‚ó®](https://twitter.com/nounish) team and posted on social networks.

# PropBox: A Nouns Proposal Incubator

## TL;DR

Using lessons from a Nouncil trial program, we will set up a robust incubator that will help the best builders in the ecosystem smoothly navigate the Nouns DAO proposal process.  

**Our goal is to leverage the breadth and depth of skillsets within UglyDAO to help nounish builders communicate well and find pathways to funding, so that they can keep doing what they do best:** 

**BUILDING.**

[![andrew-propbox.gif](https://i.postimg.cc/fbwksjjM/andrew-propbox.gif)](https://vimeo.com/774011051/886e16a979)
*Click to watch a 3 minute video summary of this proposal.*

# The Challenges



1. **The Nouns DAO Proposal Process Can be Daunting to New Builders.**
    
    Writing a proposal is difficult. Conveying a good idea in a way that voters can understand and relate to is even more difficult.  With the increased number of proposals and ideas coming in weekly, it‚Äôs more important than ever to effectively communicate one's idea and value proposition.  For some builders, proposal writing may not be a core strength. So their proposals may fail on-chain, even if the core concept is valuable.
    
2. **Effective Communication with DAO Voters is Difficult**
    
    One of the most difficult challenges for builders in the Nouns ecosystem has always been figuring out how to have open dialog with voting Nouners and Delegates. These challenges will only increase as the DAO grows. Now, with the Official Nouns Discord closed, this is an even more pressing issue. 
    
3. **Constructive and Honest Feedback is Rare**
    
    Very few people within Nouns are giving truly honest and constructive criticism to proposals that need work. Discourse and Nouncil feedback sometimes can be ‚Äúsoft‚Äù, as people may not want to publicly discuss the potential pitfalls of a fellow community member‚Äôs idea or hurt their feelings.  We see this occurring more frequently with on-chain proposals, and it doesn‚Äôt help anyone in the long run.



[![boxbrain.gif](https://i.postimg.cc/14xN6w0Y/boxbrain.gif)](https://postimg.cc/wRVvYtGh)*Think INSIDE the box!*


# Our Solutions

**PropBox will aim to solve the above pain points in the following ways:**

1. Ugly Dao has a talented roster of builders, many of whom have experience writing successful proposals for Prop House, NSFW and on-chain. We also have professionals with experience in the legal, marketing, education, and communications fields. With our combined training and experience, we can help builders create proposals that make an impact. Additionally, sometimes the most difficult part of seeking funding from Nouns is **knowing where to go.** We can help proposers understand if their idea is best suited to a Prop House round, an NSFW pitch, a discussion with the newly minted DCS Pod, or a full on-chain proposal. Finally, we believe that proposals should lean on multimedia content to achieve maximum impact in an attention-scarce environment. We want to help builders integrate engaging videos and visuals into their proposals.

2. We know the Nouns community like the back of our Ugly hand, and can help new builders navigate the difficult task of amplifying the message of their proposal. From appearances on The Noun Square, discussions in Nouncil or other Nounish discords, as well as conversations on Twitter, Discourse, House of Nouns and elsewhere, we know how to help builders with the most difficult part of getting funded for a proposal: **Communicating directly with the people who ultimately will vote yes or no.** 

3. The DAO needs more well-intentioned people who are not afraid to give would-be builders The Ugly Truth, and we are prepared to do so.


# The PropBox Value Prop

Our goal is to become the premier resource to help builders create great proposals and find pathways to funding in the Nouns ecosystem. We plan to find and incubate teams and projects from multiple sources, including:

- Current builders in the ecosystem who are looking for feedback and help navigating the proposal process.
- New builders who need extra help onboarding into Nouns, writing proposals, and making the right connections to be successful.
- ‚ÄúUncut gems‚Äù from Prop House and Discourse to fund proof of concept projects and prepare the teams for potential larger on-chain proposals in the future. We aim to find builders with the highest potential and help them fulfill that potential. Ideas from this category should have at least 10x potential from the amount of initial funding.

# The Origin Story

This project began as an initiative by [Andrew ](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/andrewladdusaw.eth)[Laddusaw](https://twitter.com/AndrewLaddusaw), through [Nouncil](https://discord.gg/nouncil), following the [Combinator Round in Prop House](https://prop.house/nouns/open-round:-25-eth) back in July (aka ‚Äúthe before times.‚Äù) Andrew saw a lot of talented teams that submitted great proposals, but of course the round only had one winner for the 25ETH prize. 

He began contacting builders and building a system within Nouncil Discord to give these teams feedback to prepare them for an on-chain proposal, or to help them secure alternative funding sources. When they began reviewing proposals publicly as a group, other builders asked for help as well.

During this initial trial, the Incubator team gave feedback to 9 proposals. Through that process: One secured funding through NSFW. One pursued another Prop House to fund a proof of concept, won, and later joined Nouncil. One ended up abandoning the initial idea, but moved on to other projects during the incubation process, and has now been funded for multiple other projects within the DAO (shout out [ripe0x](https://nounsagora.com/delegate/ripe0x.eth).) Two other proposals ended up with on-chain votes, one narrowly being defeated and one securing funding for 40 ETH (Prop 144 for One Click Bots). 

[![andre-testimonial.gif](https://i.postimg.cc/JnndSt6P/andre-testimonial.gif)](https://vimeo.com/774010662/b852cb4533)
*Click to watch a 2 minute PropBox testimonial video from Andrei (BotFrens)*

We learned a lot through this experiment. We‚Äôre continuing to follow up with the builders as they hone their ideas, and expect to see even more fruit from these efforts in the coming months. We‚Äôre also continuing to improve our feedback process and we believe we‚Äôre ready for the next phase of growth.


# The Timeline

**This proposal will support the PropBox team for a 3 month period to do the following:**

- Actively locate builders in the ecosystem to help drive their ideas forward and guide them through the proposal process that is most appropriate to their ideas and building stage.
- Create an active Builder‚Äôs Guild in the PropBox Discord, where those who are creating tools and proposals can do so in the open, and together. This well help create consistent startup energy in the Nouns community.
- Review every Discourse, and various Discord community posts, making sure everyone submitting proposal ideas gets quality feedback and the best possible Nouns experience when they first arrive in the community. One of our greatest desires is that new, talented builders would not leave the community discouraged after getting negative feedback, simply because they didn‚Äôt understand the funding process or the culture of what it means to be a part of Nouns.
- Create a website to house a toolkit of templates, best practices, tips and tricks, and contact information giving builders a toolbox to maximize success.
- We will also spend the next three months exploring several ideas, which we will present to the community at the end of the proposal funding period:
    - *How to potentially make an incubator like this self-sustaining in the future.*
    - *A system to temperature check proposals and gather feedback from as many sources as possible, including from those with the most likelihood to swing vote outcomes.*
    - *How to create efficiencies in the proposal process, so that new community members can transition from their first interactions to building as effectively as possible within the DAO.*
    - *Exploring systems of trust-building to make sure that scammers are not able to abuse the treasury through gaming or fraud.*
    - *Decisions about what form this group should take in the future; how to incorporate new members, ideas, and processes to maintain the highest degree of quality feedback, help, and value to the DAO.*


All of the above is to serve the ultimate goals of PropBox: 

**To help builders write high quality proposals, and to make decision-making simpler and less time-consuming for DAO members.**

# The Budget

**75ETH** **Total**

- **60 ETH** - In our trial, we were able to achieve a great deal of success with people who were just volunteering their time. We know that with DAO funding, we will have much more capacity to onboard talented builders and incubate many more proposals. 
    - **20 ETH** per month as a payment to team members, to be paid retroactively based on work completed and builders helped. This work will include engaging builders at every stage of the proposal process, guiding them, and helping to write effective and media-rich proposals. These team rewards will be distributed via biweekly Coordinape rounds (Nouncil model.) All payment data will be publicly available to the DAO. 
    - Our team goal will be to engage with a minimum of 30 builders about their proposals over the course of a 3 month period. 
    
- **10 ETH** for a pool to fund some small projects, as an experiment in additional targeted flexible funding for the DAO: Taking small ideas that we encounter through the process of our work and helping those teams to execute small ideas or create MVPs of larger ones. 
- **5 ETH** of retro funding for what has been done to build this system already.

### **Introduction**

Hello **NounsDAO**,

I'm **Voadz**, one of the Nouncillors. Periodically, I've seen a tonne of contests hosted by our nounish communities such as [coloring book contests](https://nounsarchive.wtf/portfolio/nounsense-02) by Noun22 & Messhup, [memes contests](https://nounsarchive.wtf/portfolio/noadz-valentines-day) by Noadz, and is now mainly being held by the [Noun Square](https://twitter.com/thenounsquare) team. We have seen full of delightful contest submissions with all sorts of genres from all across the world.

I took an initiative to build a website where we can display all of the entries from NounsDAO's contestants because I personally feel it is very important for the DAO to do so. Additionally, it provides access to all future possibilities. 

As time passes, I feel it needs to grow even more by including all of the Nouns projects from the community and not only the contestants. Our memes proliferations are all contained inside.

Why is it important to document and archive these things?

> "The body continuously explores time and space. It holds our history, if we listen closely." -Chloe Chotrani

![](https://i.imgur.com/aDIU2rB.jpg)

---

### **Summary**

* **Long-term Vision** ; 
    * To retain past and future historical key data of all talented builders & artists that contribute around Nouns ecosystem.

* **Objective** ; 
    * 1) To help **onboard newcomers** that are interested in Nouns so they can catch a **glimpse** of what the project is all about. Navigation will be improved through enhanced visual design to create a stronger first impression.
    * 2) **References that act as inspiration**. Drawing from references is beneficial because it provides our imaginations with tangible things to model after.
    * 3) To create potential opportunity for artists / builders to receive **commissions or collaborative works/projects** with others.

* **Strategy** ; 
    * 1) **Simplified TL;DR / streamlined landing page with upgraded visuals** consists of ; *to browse relevant areas & specific parameters* ;
            * simplified projects/contests brief
            * project owner/hosts
            * total funded/prizes
            * categories (*ex; art, community, tech, marketing, physical etc*)
            * links to discourse/full props/related infos/contests
            * social media (*ex; twitter, discord*)
            * tags / filters *(most recent, oldest, alphabetically)*
            * distinct project images with descriptions
            * status
            * contest winners
            * CC0 label together with proof of CC0 (*ex; toggle/submit forms etc*)
            * search bar with data points
            *( all are shown under **Details**)*

    * 2) **Coordinate with other existing platforms** already in place (ex. ***[nouns.center](https://nouns.center/), [proposal.wtf](https://maty-eth.notion.site/maty-eth/NounsDAO-Proposals-Overview-b8c76e6ac8e44515966ee032ea20f860), [nounish](https://twitter.com/nounish)***) by pooling resources & efforts for maximum efficiency and also to complement each other.
    * 3) **Contents sustainability** ; we will be using Notion for the database and will be publically viewable. Content submission form with formats will be available for community use. An additional idea is to work with Nouns AI team for data scraping by using certain hashtags/keywords *(to be discuss)*.
    * 4) **CC0 Contents & Icon** ; any artist can **enable or declare** their work to be CC0 by submitting forms that will be made available soon. It is freely usable by anyone for remixing and other creative purposes. A "CC0" icon will appear that contains additional proof of CC0.
    * 5) A **daily dose of nounish things** ; daily curated posting of one random nounish project to give more **visibility & brand consistency** for long term goals.
    * 6) Main whiteboard to organise works ; [Nouns Archive's FigJam](https://www.figma.com/file/g1etPE6nK6WtwK35i9C8gs/Nouns-Archive?node-id=0%3A1).

    * 3) Organic views and engagements will always be the baseline metrics, but currently, **85%** of the contents are exclusively focus on contest entries. We anticipate that the graph will eventually be higher once we have completed building an MVP jointly across all nounish projects.
![](https://i.imgur.com/C8Iu47E.png)


* **Deliverables** ;

    * 2) **On-the-go** website with comprehensive materials, including numerous projects and submissions.
    * 3) As per said under ***Strategy***.

* **What we have delivered** ;

# Nouns funding ZachXBT

[@ZachXBT](https://twitter.com/zachxbt) is a public good serving the crypto ecosystem through tireless research exposing [countless scams](https://investigations.notion.site/). Recent events have highlighted the dire need and importance of such work. This prop proposes to fund 100 ETH to their donation address: zachxbt.eth (address can be verified from their twitter profile).

Donations have always been somewhat controversial within Nouns governance. [Prop 21](https://nouns.wtf/vote/21) donating 169 ETH to Gitcoin grants was one of the most contentious votes in our early history. [Prop 108](https://nouns.wtf/vote/108) donating 500 ETH to Ethereum protocol development (via the Protocol Guild) was much more unanimous but still there was discomfort and discourse around whether the DAO was becoming "a tax inefficient way for DAO members to make donations." 

I agree that we shouldn't resort to becoming a complacent vehicle of passive philanthropy. We should instead aim to actively contribute and be a net producer of public goods ourselves such that our meme (brand) can fully capture the provenance value (claim on originality of) the public work and thus leverage the virtuous cycle to do more than what capital alone could have done. However, there should be exceptions to this rule if there is an urgent and common public cause that warrants highlighting. I would like to suggest that this is such a case. Crypto needs more validators like ZachXBT.

With donations we need to be extra wary of conflicts of interest or self-dealing. Unfortunately there is no way to prove this cryptographically, but I attest that I have no prior (or planned future) relationship with ZachXBT and that today was the first time I contacted them (via twitter) to ask for their permission to make this proposal.

# Explorer Grants - Trial

![image](https://aws1.discourse-cdn.com/standard21/uploads/nouns/optimized/2X/b/be6270ef4049c16180cde5177b5c21ac878d1b7b_2_690x431.png)

# Explorer Grants - Trial

**Core Issue:** A lot of talented builders have Nouns on their radar, but are not sure how to contribute. The only place we actively incentivize them with ideas and funding is Prop House mandated rounds, which are retroactive, leaving builders who lose the round uncompensated for their work. Otherwise, they must figure out problems themselves and then ask for money, a difficult process if someone has no connections to the ecosystem.

**Solution:** Create a program to actively recruit new talented builders and pro-actively fund them to explore the Nouns ecosystem.

### TL;DR
* 1 grant = 10 ETH for 2 months of exploration, goal for each builder is to have an on-chain prop by end of the period
* 5 builders (50 ETH total) in first trial run
* 3 members on operations team (mrtn, jihad, dot), lightly compensated; 2 more on multi-sig (yitong and krel)
* Transparency is key

### Eligibility
- Must NOT be actively or recently funded by Nouns, or clearly an existing participant in the Nouns ecosystem
- Must be new to the broader Nouns ecosystem
- Must be working / actively exploring _something_ directly related to NounsDAO while on grant, or it will be revoked
- Preference for people who can proactively create independently ‚Äî particularly engineers, but also content creators, designers, writers, etc

### Operation Details
The entire process will be transparent via a public Discord and run by the 3-person team, who will be lightly compensated to do this work, ensuring accountability and commitment. Our initial proposal had no funding for the team, but we were recommended otherwise by Nouners.

**Public Application:**
* Explorer Grants will be publicized via Twitter, 1:1 outreach from the team and its network, Twitter Spaces with Nouns community organizations, Discords, etc
* Candidates will submit public applications, showing past work and motivations for exploring the Nouns ecosystem, as well as a couple problem spaces that interest them
  * These applications will also benefit the community at large who can recruit builders from this group
* Candidates will largely be assessed on talent, potential, and excitement about Nouns. Reasoning for accepted candidates will be made public. The 3-person team will decide on 4 final candidates to accept.
* 1 slot in the program will be allocated to a Nouns community vote

**Program:**
* 10 ETH for 2 months of part-time exploration for each builder
  * *Detail: Overpaying slightly is critical to attracting talent that may not otherwise come to us. We are targeting people who make more than $150,000 a year in their full-time job*
* Weekly check-in call with builders. Members of the Explorer Grants team will help them explore ideas, connect them to Nouners and builders, and lead workshops
* **End of Program Objective:** each builder submits an on-chain or Prop House prop for continued funding

### Team
* **mrtn, lead organizer:**
    * Previously a PM at Google and NBA Top Shot, he has now contributed to a variety of Nounish projects - Nouns Builder, AI Pod, Agora, as well as doing a 24 Hour Nounish live stream, and receiving a Governance Historian grant. At USC, he ran an organization that guided students towards entrepreneurship, whose members include several YC startups. He's a big believer in diversifying funding sources for Nouns builders, and experimenting with the patronage model. *Comp: 3 ETH / month*
* **jihad, community & product expert:**
    * Core contributor at Forefront, creating media and building infrastructure for tokenized communities. He is also a delegate and ‚ÄúLil Nouncilor‚Äù at Lil Nouns DAO, a contributor to Public Nouns, one of the winners of the recent Nouns Agora delegate race, and is part of the team building [Adjectives](nouns.terminal.co), an analytics and proposal evaluation platform for Nouns DAO. Jihad believes that Nouns must be a center of excellence for tokenized communities, and the Explorer Grants program would be a step in the right direction in attracting the brightest minds to do focused yet unstructured work in the Nouns ecosystem. *Comp 2 ETH / month*
* **dot, technical expert:**
    * Dot is an iOS dev turned nounish builder - a founding member of Nouncil and most recently Lil Nounder at Lil Nouns DAO; the first full fork of Nouns DAO. Dot started Lil Nouns as a way to expose nouns to as many people as possible. Lil Nouns DAO leverages its 8 nouns alongside its own treasury to fund and support public goods built by lil nouners. In doing so, Lil Nouns has become a builder onramp to Nouns DAO itself. *Comp: 2 ETH / month*

***We will use a 3 of 5 multi-sig, with the core team members as well as krel and yitong.***

### Questions
**How will you actually find these builders?** Our team has fairly deep networks within the crypto and broader tech space; we'll leverage our personal connections as well as our social media presence to find more builders. Additionally, a large appeal of programs like these (Thiel Fellowship, Prop House, MacArthur Grants) is the benefit of continued funding + prestige, which we intend to lean into.

**But what if the builders don't do anything?** This is similar to everything in Nouns already - there's a social contract to uphold, someone could always dissapear after receiving 200 ETH on-chain. We can setup the grant via Sablier to revoke if a builder goes MIA, however.

**What will they actually build?** The first round will not have a particular mandate but future ones could be structured closer to Prop House mandated rounds, where there is a theme. We believe that time and freedom is key to allowing talented builders to find something meaningful to build long-term.

**Why not just run this on Prop House?** Decisions are not always best made by large committees. Prop House rounds do not allow for deep conversation and analysis of candidates. A transparent, small committee allows for depth and betting on candidates who might not otherwise get a shot (i.e. people who aren't good at writing a description on prop house but would be amazing builders). Additionally, we'd like to create a long-term relationship with these builders via an organized cohort.

**What if no good work comes out of this?** That's a possibility, as is the case with prop house rounds. However, we believe that Nouns already has a great enough brand to attract solid builders. However, if nothing goods comes out of this trial, then we will have learned that pro-active grants for attracting builders is not a valid technique for our DAO. If there are takeaways, they can be adapted into other funding sources, like Prop House or NSFW in the future.

**Why are you being paid?** Our initial proposal did not include payment for the team, but it was suggested by Nouners that we should be getting paid to create accountability, as well as allow us to dedicate more time in making this more of a full-fledged program than one-off grants with no support from us.

### Total Funding
5 Builders x 10 ETH = 50 ETH
Team Comp: 14 ETH
Total: 64 ETH

# Worst Case Decision x Nouns - Episodic Video NFTs

![](https://hackmd.io/_uploads/Bygv3XEIj.gif)

     
Hey Nouns DAO,

Artist and slapstick conceptualist [Marc Horowitz](http://1833marcive.com/) here, with a proposal to co-create a Nouns DAO-ified season of my new serialized NFT video collection, Worst Case Decision. It‚Äôs like Adult Swim on a dozen espresso shots, in one-minute-or-less episodes, released as 1/1 NFTs.

This is an opportunity to expand Nouns DAO culture by unleashing highly visible artist-created, community-developed CC0 video content that can be distributed everywhere. It‚Äôs also a brand-new way to use web3 tooling to release episodic videos, and an opportunity to pioneer a decentralized media production model that can help inform the future of entertainment. 
**takes a breath*

Read on and watch the below video to learn more.

[![Worst Case Decision](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/Nouns_WCD_Pitch_vid_screenshot_1500x.jpg)
](https://vimeo.com/772223496/a53f2e2dad "Worst Case Decision")


## What‚Äôs Worst Case Decision?
Worst Case Decision is maybe the first episodic ‚Äúshow‚Äù to be released as an NFT series.

Each season of WCD features 7 bite-sized fever dreams that are handcrafted into 30-70 second ‚Äúepisodes.‚Äù Every episode chases surreal characters along a bat-shit hyper-casual narrative that loosely follows a theme. So far we‚Äôve explored themes such as ‚Äúmayonnaise portal,‚Äù ‚Äúeveryone is wet,‚Äù ‚Äúhi-fi asparagus rain,‚Äù and ‚Äútoo many cats,‚Äù to name a few.

The show‚Äôs vibe feels like surfing in a sea of technicolor absurdity, with a low-fi, internet-infused, stop-motion animation style. Video, painting, web3, DALL-E, comedy, commerce‚Ä¶ WCD has it all. (Scroll to the bottom of this proposal to view sample episodes.)

**Worst Case Decision Quick Facts:**

* 50 Seasons planned, 7 episodes per season (350 episodes total)
* Episodes released episodically as 1/1 video NFTs via worstcasedecision.com
* Each season features an ever-changing cast of characters and collaborators
* NFTs can be purchased with credit card and digital currency (ETH)

## What makes this exciting for Nouns DAO?
We‚Äôre at the dawn of a new era for entertainment‚Äîone that will enable audiences and creators to build sustainable models of cultural production together. As perhaps the first-ever serialized 1/1 NFT video collection, Worst Case Decision is taking a pioneering approach to launching meme-y, weird, funny narrative shorts with and for the communities who believe this kind of art should exist in the world. 

Beyond pioneering this new web3-native episodic production model, there are a few specific benefits that Nouners can expect from supporting this project:

**Noun-ified Episodes**
The entire season will be built based on decentralized creative direction by opening up key decisions to the Nouners (and in some cases the internet at large, for max visibility). This includes community input/voting on:
* The ‚Äúthemes‚Äù of each episode
* Protagonists (I‚Äôve got so many weird character ideas, man)
* Supporting cast (really, so many weird characters)
* Episode backgrounds

**CC0 Content & Nouns Memes**
The Nouns season of WCD will be entirely CC0. This means that anyone can meme the shit out of the entire season, which will be full of Nouns references, noggles, and other inside jokes specific to Nouns‚Äô community, culture, and lore. Cut up and re-mix the episodes however y‚Äôall see fit, and post wherever you want.

**Additional Benefits to Nouns DAO**

1)	**Major marketing and PR exposure.** This is a first-of-its-kind video collection in the NFT space, and there‚Äôs ‚Äúa lot of press to be had.‚Äù
2)	**WCD is planned for 50 seasons.** Nouns would be the 3rd season of 50, and the first-ever sponsored season‚Äîrepresenting an early entry into supporting what could become a historic release.
3)	**Introduce Marc‚Äôs audience to Nouns.** I‚Äôve been an independent artist for 25 years, and as a result I‚Äôm decently well known. I can help bring the fine art world‚Äôs attention to Nouns and web3 at large.
4)	**Reach non-web3-savvy folks, too.** Our tech partner [Hashku](https://hashku.com) has both crypto-native and custodial credit card minting solutions, meaning that non-crypto folks can participate in NFT auctions.

![](https://cdn.hashku.com/wcd/nouns_pfp_collage%20copy_sm.jpg)

These are just mere examples of potential Nouns x WCD characters! Glorious, yes? Please feel free to take ‚Äòem and make ‚Äòem [your PFPs](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1Ff52SL1p3PGzdxYtCO7kyA9kpE2N4EAY?usp=share_link). (Shhhh‚Ä¶. there will be plenty more via https://nouns.build/ in the future.) 

## What makes this exciting for Collectors?
I care immensely about my collectors. I want to add value and make the experience as fun and engaging as the episodes themselves. We have an expansive vision and are thrilled to include our collectors along this journey. 

If you are a holder of a WCD episode from any season, you‚Äôll get access to:

* My network via a private discord channel for collectors (a seat on the board so to speak)
* Input on IRL WCD events
* Early access to future WCD collabs and projects  

## Marketing & Community Development
Our philosophy for marketing and PR follows the vision for the project. Simply put: Our weird creative vision and IRL performances are going to cause some really interesting responses, which we‚Äôll engage with using our built-in strengths with social media and PR.

**Marketing Plan**

* **Launch activities** ‚Äì Our team will produce strategic content and a mix of online and IRL activations to generate as much pre-launch awareness as possible. We have an existing list of interested & interesting media partners to engage here. The web3 PR agency Serotonin is among them.
*  **High-velocity engagement** ‚Äì A dedicated Project Ambassador will act as a marketing strategist, online social maestro, and Nouns champion, using multi-channel engagement tactics to build momentum. 

* **Partnerships & sponsorships** ‚Äì I (Marc) have a long history of partnering with brands to co-create projects. We will be bringing on some truly exciting collaborators and sponsors to spread the word even farther.

* **Long-term community growth** ‚Äì Our desire is to make this project fully self-sustaining. To do this, our goal is to increase the performance of NFT auctions and overall engagement with the series by aggressively growing the WCD community. 

* **Transparent success metrics** ‚Äì We will track and analyze meaningful engagement metrics to keep the community informed on how we‚Äôre doing, and to strengthen our marketing approaches overall.

## Open-Sourcing Our Promo Strategy

We wish to be as transparent as possible with our learnings about marketing and running this project. We‚Äôll create a public document outlining our goals, metrics, successes, and learnings so that our efforts can help future projects and the community at large.

Director fee, cinematographer/camera operator fee, additional creative direction and shoot crew/collaborators, daily incidentals during shoot (food, grip, etc), and production assistance.

Sound finishing/sfx/sound design, music licensing, editing, smart contract customizations for specific season NFTs, season-specific website costs (video bandwidth and hosting).

Spread the word about the Nouns DAO and its sponsored season of WCD via strategic editorial write ups, podcast appearances, live events, IRL media stunts/performances, and other activations TBD.  See further notes in ‚ÄúMarketing Plan‚Äù (above).

## Timeline & Logistics

**Mid-late February, 2023:** Launch the project with unsponsored seasons 1 and 2.

**Mid-January:** Collaborate with the Nouns community. Using voting mechanisms and other means of gathering community input, we will collectively shape WCD season 3.

**Mid-late January:** Once our Nouns season is planned, each episode takes roughly 2 days to film and edit. That brings pre-production, production, and post-production to 3-4 weeks total.

## How NFT Auctions Will Work on worstcasedecision.com
Each season of WCD video episodes will be dropped over the course of a week (dates will be announced via [@marchorowitz](https://twitter.com/marchorowitz)).
* Each day at 9am PST a new episode will drop on worstcasedecision.com
* Each episode will be released as a 1/1 NFT 
* Each NFT‚Äôs auction will end at 8:55:59 am PST the following day
* When one auction closes, the next one drops‚Äîand this continues for 7 days in a row, Mon‚ÄìSun.

## The Future of WCD and Episodic NFTs
We have the team and vision required to evolve WCD into a genre-defining series. Beyond this, we think we‚Äôre onto something in regards to how serialized NFTs can be used as a sustainable model to fund the production of some truly weird and great videos‚Äîand other creations as well.

If you are interested in learning more and chatting with Marc and the team personally, please reach out and we‚Äôll have a chat ;)

# Nouns Stories: Short Shorts

![](https://i.imgur.com/mCy0tjV.png)


## TL;DR
A team of award-winning animators and executives in primetime animation have teamed up with Nouns Stories to commission 10 comedic Nouns shorts. 


---


## Short Shorts - Season 1

We're commissioning 10 shorts for 6 ETH each. 5 of the shorts will be commissioned through a Prop House round. We will hand pick, and noun pill, five of our favorite creators to complete the other 5 shorts.

**The Rules**
1. The short must be funny.
2. The short must be 15 seconds.
3. The short must feature at least one Noun.

Proposers will submit a portfolio (or at least one example of previous work) + a 1 sentence creative pitch for their short.

**Distribution**

Once the 10 shorts are complete we will plan for an entertaining online premiere, looking to collaborate with people in the Nouniverse, creators, and media outlets with established audiences. Then we will upload these to our own branded social media accounts and anywhere else on the internet that will showcase them. We will also provide the video files publically, allowing anyone to use them in future Nounish projects and news.

**Awards**

We have an additional 20 ETH to award as prizes. We'll experiment with a variety of prizes and allocation methods including token gated Nounish community votes, live celebrity critic votes, and somehow we're going to get Goldy's dog to choose one prize winner. Also included will be a prize specifically for the best CC0 shorts to incentivize creators to release their content CC0.

All of our these additional prizes will be open to public submissions - artists not selected and funded through Prop House can create their short anyways and have another shot at competing for the prizes.

**Branding**

10 ETH is included to cover basic branding needed for this Prop House round. This could include logos, a simple website, a Nouns Shorts video bumper to play between shorts, etc. We will return any ETH we do not use to the treasury.


---

# Nouns X Everybody

# TL;DR

This proposal will differentiate itself from other Nouns proposals aiming to create content for the Nouns (such as [165](https://nouns.wtf/vote/165), [113](https://nouns.wtf/vote/113) and [143](https://nouns.wtf/vote/143)) by focusing on creating an open process which will allow anyone to create a hype video.

While this prop is similar to [Prop 180](https://nouns.wtf/vote/180) , they are very different in their process, scope and goals. Nouns X Everybody is more about the process itself (which could be applied to other areas, not just content creation). Additionally, although this proposal pays more to the winning submissions - it is doing so because it requires the team to produce AND distribute without a guarantee of payment. While the number of views are not everything, they do matter, as we can have the highest quality content in the world but it only matters if people see it. 

Instead of determining what we think people will want to see, this proposal will instead outline the guidelines in terms of output as well as the minimum result we want achieved in terms of outcome. Leaving it open for anyone to implement their own creative process in order to achieve that result.

By funding this the proposal we would hope to achieve the goals of:


* Having a minimum of 10 pieces of original video content created, each with a minimum of 2k views on YouTube (20k total views minimum but I would expect much much more).
* Getting new and innovative ideas from both from within and outside of our existing community by allowing them creative control on the output.
* Bringing people into the Nouniverse as they will need to learn more about Nouns so as to create content which will enable them to win this challenge.
* Showcase how the various elements of the DAO (see: ‚ÄòThe Process‚Äô) can be combined to create a cohesive process for project implementation.
* Demonstrating a proposal process that brings benefit to the DAO and rewards creators while not requiring compensation for the proposer. With 86% going to content creators, 12% going to marketing and just 1% going to administration along with 1% earmarked for an independent report on effectiveness of the proposal after 9 months. 


---
 
 

# THE BRIEF

**Create a short hype video that either explains or pulls people into the Nouniverse and if your video gets over 2k views on YouTube before April 30th 2023 you could be awarded part of the $200k fund.**

The **Top 10 Videos** ranked by number of YouTube views that meet the minimum entry requirements below will be put up for a vote where **4 winners** will be selected and awarded **$50k each**.

* Any person or team is free to submit an entry to this challenge. 
* To enter, simply create your video, upload it to YouTube and get people to watch it.

___

_**MINIMUM QUALIFYING CRITERIA**_ 

- Has more than 2000 organic views on Youtube by the end of the Submission Period
- Must meet the brief (i.e. It either ‚Äòexplains the Nouns‚Äô or ‚Äòpulls people into the Nouniverse‚Äô)
- Content must be original. While videos may reuse existing content if it is not mostly original it will not qualify.
- Is positive in nature and is rated PG
- Must be a video and not a YouTube "shorts"
- Should include ‚Äò#EnterTheNouniverse‚Äô in the description (so we can easily filter submissions)


---

Complete creative freedom is given to entrants on how they want to achieve the goal ‚Äì it can be animated, live footage, a mixture of both or something completely different. Some teams might focus on higher end productions that explains Nouns to people while others might focus on something simple and unique that pulls people into the Nouniverse (i.e. see the different approach[ Coinbase](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uJ9pNQrz0fA&ab_channel=AnthonyKalamut) had vs other cypto companies during the superbowl in trying to achieve the same result). It is up to the creator to do what they think will work.



---
 

## SELECTION CRITERIA

The **Top 8 Videos with the most views on YouTube + 2 Videos chosen by the Selection Committee** will be entered into the Voting Round ‚Äì where Noun holders will vote for the 4 winners of $50k each.



* All videos must meet the minimum qualification criteria
* Selected entries will be free to provide any additional information at this stage to be included in their entry which demonstrates why their content should win (for example, data from other social media platforms like Twitter, TikTok or any other measure of engagement)
* Selected entries may be asked to provide information to the selection committee proving that their YouTube views were organic that the data has not been manipulated or paid for.
* A person/team can submit as many entries as they want but only their best entry (which they can choose)  will be selected for the final vote.
* We are including 2 videos selected by the committee due to the fact that some entries may not be in the Top 10 in terms of views of YouTube but may have merit for nomination through a disproportionate level of engagement on other channels and/or be of exceptional quality or have uploaded their video late in the process but has gained a lot of views in a short time period.
---
 
 

# THE PROCESS

If this proposal is successful, the following process will take place:



1. **Proposal Passes:** $200k and 25 Eth with be transferred to a multisig controlled by the Multisig. The challenge has officially started.
2. **Submission Period:** There is a 5 Month window for anyone to create and publish their hype video.
3. **Create Marketing Dept:** 25 Eth will immediately be used to fund a Prop House Round with 5 Eth being awarded to the 5 best proposals detailing how they will market and find entrants for this project. (see note at bottom)
4. **Selection Period:** When the submission period has ended on April 30th 2023 there will be a 2 week selection period where the creators of the Top 10 videos will be invited by the Selection Committee to make their submissions. These submissions, including any additional information the creator wants to provide, will be uploaded to a Prop House round by the Selection Committee.The selection committee will be paid 3 eth for administering this.
5. **Voting Round:** Nouns will have a 1 week voting period to cast their votes for the 4 winning submissions to be awarded $50k each.
6. **Payment:** Funds will be distributed to the Winners by the Trusted Parties.
7. **Analysis**: 2 eth will be earmarked for an indpedent evaluation of this proposal after 9 months. To see how effective it was at achieving the stated outcome. 

_**Important Note:** If no one meets the minimum qualifying criteria, the Nouns pay nothing (with the exception of the 25 eth used to fund the marketing dept prop house round) and all funds are returned to the Treasury. But for every person or team that does meet the criteria, we have at the very least a piece of original video content with more that 2k views on YouTube._ 




** **

**Selection Committee:** The Selection committee will be comprised of 5 independent members of the Noun community, selected by Hindsight, whose job it will be: (a) select the Top 10 videos to be included in the final Noun vote as per the minimum qualifying criteria and the selection criteria above, (b) contact these creators to submit any additional information for the final vote and (c) upload those submissions to a Prop House vote.

The work of the selection committee is minimal and mostly administrative (checking that views are organic etc) and as such will only require 3 eth (of which I will get none).

_In order to maintain independence and to ensure a fair process members of the selection committee cannot enter a video to the challenge_


---

**Stated Goals of this Proposal** 
If this proposal passes, it success or failure will be measured against meeting the following criteria:
* The creation of a minimum of 10 pieces of good quality, original content before April 30th
* A minimum of 100k cumulative organic YouTube views across all content created in persuit of this prize before 9 months of this proposal passing
___



**Team** 
Really the point of this prop is that there is no 'team' but for the interest of transparency and to include a section I think should be in all props:
* Hindsight: I am not a member of any other teams, councils or projects and I do not receive any compensation from any DAO source. I have no conflicts of interest and will not financially benefit from this proposal.
* My only role will be to be on the multisig and to choose the selection commitee (A role I would be happy to give to someone else if they are suitable and want it!)


---

**Transaction Details**



* 30 Eth will be transferred to fund a Prop House Round to create a marketing team for the challenge, the selection committee administration cost and the retrospective report on outcome.
* $200k USD will be transferred to fund the prize pool.

_If less than 4 teams do not meet the minimum qualifying criteria then any USDC that has not been used will be returned to the treasury._

**Total Cost:** $200k + 30 Eth

**Multisig**

The multisig is a 3/5 consisting of the 5 best looking members of the dao

* [Hindsight](https://twitter.com/0Hindsight)
* [Elad](https://twitter.com/eladmallel)
* [Jarmen](https://twitter.com/jarmen43)
* [Maty](https://twitter.com/matyETH)
* [Adrianmcli](https://twitter.com/adrianmcli)

___

**A note on the 'Marketing Dept' creation**


The prop house round for 25 eth will award 5 submissions 5 eth to market this challenge and try and find people and teams outside both inside and outside of Nouns to make submissions. I will draft the prop house round if this proposal succeeds. An idea of submissions that will be encouraged are: contacting media schools, creating a landing pages with instructions, engaging with influencers to promote etc. 

___


**Why YouTube Views**


As stated earlier, YouTube views are not everything, but they do matter and after looking at the view count of Nouns content I think we could benefit from a proposal with a proposal that has goals in terms of distribution as well as production. 

Many of these videos will have more views on Twitter and other platforms and I would expect the same from any video created for this challenge. But for the interest of managing the proposal we will have to set one medium as the primary one for measurement and I think YouTube is the most appropriate.

2k views to reach the minimum entry requirement may seem small, and it is, but remember this is a MINIMUM, and we would expect any video that qualifies in the Top 10 to have many more views than that. 

Here you can see how many views Nounish content is currently getting on YouTube
[![YT-V.jpg](https://i.postimg.cc/XYSbwxm9/YT-V.jpg)](https://postimg.cc/bsTWP0zv)

While some content that that use gimmicks, shows a lack of creativity nor effort, or does not show a clear comprehension of what the Nouns ecosystem is may meet the minimum qualifying criteria (whether due to the creator having large existing YouTube following or otherwise), ultimately the winning pieces of content be decided upon by a Nouner vote and so are extremely unlikely to be awarded anything for their efforts. So anyone who creates a video with the expectation of success should keep it classy and keep it Nounish.
